definitions.definition: A heavy subatomic particle created by the binding of quarks by gluons ; a hadron containing three quarks. Baryons have half-odd integral spin and are thus fermions . This category includes the common proton and neutron of the atomic nucleus .

main_definition: ( particle physics ) A heavy subatomic particle created by the binding of quarks by gluons ; a hadron containing three quarks. Baryons have half-odd integral spin and are thus fermions . This category includes the common proton and neutron of the atomic nucleus .
